text: The 1984 European Karate Championships (19th edition) were held in Paris, France from 11–13 May 1984. ==Medalists== ===Men's competition=== ====Individual==== {| |- | Kata | Dario Marchini | Luis Maria Sanz | Deogracias Medina |- | Kumite −60 kg | Francesco D'Agostino | Abdu Shaher | Evaristo Criado Tim Stephens |- | Kumite −65 kg | Janne Timone | David Coulter | Ricardo Abad Cebolla Max Dorville |- | Kumite −70 kg | Gonzalo "Gonchi" Rodríguez Bognoli | Thierry Masci | Thomas Burns Jukka Lindström |- | Kumite −75 kg | Kenneth Leeuwin | Gérald Sauthier | Didier Moreau Fred Royers |- | Kumite −80 kg | Claude Pettinella | Otti Roethoff | (first name unknown) Cornwall Manuel Egea |- | Kumite +80 kg | Vic Charles | Patrice Ruggiero | Mark Akinlami José Manuel Egea |- | Kumite Open | Patrice Ruggiero | Emmanuel Pinda | Toni Dietl Claudio Guazzaroni |} ====Team==== {| |- | Kata | | | |- | Kumite | | | |} ===Women's competition=== ====Individual==== {| |- | Kata | Helen Raye | Marisa Rozalen | ??? Sanchez |- | Kumite −53 kg | Sophie Berger | ??? | ??? ??? |- | Kumite −60 kg | Beverly Morris | Angelika Förster | Daniela Galilei ??? |- | Kumite +60 kg | Guus van Mourik | ??? | ??? ??? |} ====Team==== {| |- | Kata | | | |- |Kumite | | ??? | ??? |} ==References== 1984 Category:International sports competitions hosted by France European Karate Championships European championships in 1984 Category:International sports competitions hosted by Paris Category:1984 in Paris Category:Karate competitions in France Category:May 1984 sports events in Europe
title: 1984 European Karate Championships
